FuncDef:
The loss-measure single-ended-synthetic receive command enables a peer device to receive synthetic loss measurement (SLM) frames for single-ended SLM.
The undo loss-measure single-ended-synthetic receive command disables the peer device from receiving SLM frames.
By default, no device in a Maintenance Association (MA) is enabled to receive SLM frames.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a test instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Timeout period for the receive end to receive SLM frames.
The value is an integer ranging from 10 to 300, in seconds. The default value is 300s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the loss-measure single-ended-synthetic send command is run to configure single-ended on-demand SLM and the loss-measure single-ended-synthetic continual send command is run to configure single-ended proactive SLM, run the loss-measure single-ended-synthetic receive command to enable the peer device to receive SLM frames.
Prerequisites
Ensure that the following commands have been run:
IEEE Standard 802.1ag-2007 of Connectivity Fault Management (CFM) has been specified using the cfm version standard command in the system view.The CFM function has been enabled globally using the cfm enable (system view) command in the system view.A Maintenance Domain (MD) has been created using the cfm md command in the system view.A Maintenance Association (MA)has been created using the ma command in the MD view.A test instance has been created using the test-id command.
